@SegunAndrews The green and red clock for me though. 
Reminds me of my tell-the-time-storybook. 1:15pm.
@SegunAndrews Thanks. I meant the link. I wanted to see their methodology and if anything changed
@SegunAndrews Where is the source for this. Thank you
@SegunAndrews Nigeria was never the world poverty capital at any point
@Jibsman1 I was pointing out that 87m that was reported in 2018 has been adjusted down to 62m. If we are still going by 87m, it would mean 17m moved out of extreme poverty which is not the case

@alhajabalance @SegunAndrews Check the escape rate. 

In Nigeria more people are plunging into poverty as the escape rate is negative
@SegunAndrews @alhajabalance Interesting! the methodology favour Nigeria but worked against India. That can't be fair and objective.
@abdota @SegunAndrews We and India seem to be doing relay on this,and judging from India's population, we're relatively the runaway leaders.
